intro: Securidaca schlechtendaliana, commonly known as the African sweet pea, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and the fruits are legumes that split open when mature. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
